comments:
Using eclipse SDK-20020425-linux-gtk (GTK2 version) with IBM JDK 1.3.1. I was
following the steps to create a project for robocode (
http://robocode.alphaworks.ibm.com - the tutorial for creating a project is at
http://robocode.alphaworks.ibm.com/help/ide/ide2.html ) and when I clicked in
"Add External Jars" on the library tab of java settings from the create java
project wizard, a file choosing screen popped up. I selected the correct jar
file (/home/patola/robocode/robocode.jar) and it crashed: a Window appeared with
the following message: "An Internal Error has occured. null argument: See error
log for more details. Exit workspace?"

I clicked on details, and the result was:

org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.AssertionFailedException: null argument:
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isNotNull(Assert.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isNotNull(Assert.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.initialize(Path.java:472)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.<init>(Path.java:92)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.buildpaths.LibrariesWorkbookPage.chooseExtJarFiles(LibrariesWorkbookPage.java:401)
	at

	at

	at

	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.dialogfields.ListDialogField.buttonPressed(ListDialogField.java:149)
	at

	at

	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.dialogfields.ListDialogField$1.widgetSelected(ListDialogField.java:319)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1116)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:538)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:525)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.NewProjectAction.run(NewProjectAction.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.Action.runWithEvent(Action.java:590)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection(ActionContributionItem.java:407)

org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:361)

org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$0(ActionContributionItem.java:352)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ActionListener.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java:524)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1227)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1116)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:833)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:816)

This looks like the "File name returned instead of full path" bug which is 
fixed in a recent build.  Could you try the latest build and tell us whether 
the bug is gone?
